summary.para: Creates and caches fast property helpers that expose getters for every non-hidden get property on the specified type.
excludes properties defined on base types that have been hidden by definitions using the new keyword.

member.param: The instance to extract property accessors for.
member.returns: A cached array of all public property getters from the instance's type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.GetVisibleProperties(System.Type)

summary.para: Creates and caches fast property helpers that expose getters for every non-hidden get property on the specified type.
excludes properties defined on base types that have been hidden by definitions using the new keyword.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.MakeFastPropertyGetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a single fast property getter. The result is not cached.
member.param: propertyInfo to extract the getter for.
member.remarks: This method is more memory efficient than a dynamically compiled lambda, and about the same speed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.MakeNullSafeFastPropertyGetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a single fast property getter which is safe for a null input object. The result is not cached.
member.param: propertyInfo to extract the getter for.
member.remarks: This method is more memory efficient than a dynamically compiled lambda, and about the same speed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.MakeFastPropertySetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a single fast property setter for reference types. The result is not cached.
member.param: propertyInfo to extract the setter for.
member.remarks: This method is more memory efficient than a dynamically compiled lambda, and about the same speed. This only works for reference types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.ObjectToDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary:
Given an object, adds each instance property with a public get method as a key and its associated value to a dictionary.
If the object is already an instance, then a copy is returned.
member.remarks: The implementation of PropertyHelper will cache the property accessors per-type. This is faster when the the same type is used multiple times with ObjectToDictionary.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.IViewLocationExpander
member.summary: Specifies the contracts for a view location expander that is used by instances to determine search paths for a view.
member.remarks: Individual s are invoked in two steps: (1) is invoked and each expander adds values that it would later consume as part of . The populated values are used to determine a cache key - if all values are identical to the last time was invoked, the cached result is used as the view location. (2) If no result was found in the cache or if a view was not found at the cached location, is invoked to determine all potential paths for a view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.IViewLocationExpander.PopulateValues(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.ViewLocationExpanderContext)
member.summary: Invoked by a to determine the values that would be consumed by this instance of . The calculated values are used to determine if the view location has changed since the last time it was located.
member.param: The for the current view location expansion operation.

member.summary: Invoked by a to determine potential locations for a view.
member.param: The for the current view location expansion operation.
The sequence of view locations to expand.
member.returns: A list of expanded view locations.

member.summary: A that adds the language as an extension prefix to view names. Language that is getting added as extension prefix comes from .
member.example: For the default case with no areas, views are generated with the following patterns (assuming controller is "Home", action is "Index" and language is "en") Views/Home/en/Action Views/Home/Action Views/Shared/en/Action Views/Shared/Action

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.RenderSection(System.String)
member.summary: In layout pages, renders the content of the section named .
member.param: The name of the section to render.
member.remarks: The method writes to the and the value returned is a token value that allows the Write (produced due to @RenderSection(..)) to succeed. However the value does not represent the rendered content.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.RenderSectionAsync(System.String)
member.summary: In layout pages, asynchronously renders the content of the section named .
member.returns: A that on completion returns an empty .
member.remarks: The method writes to the and the value returned is a token value that allows the Write (produced due to @RenderSection(..)) to succeed. However the value does not represent the rendered content.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.RenderSectionAsync(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: In layout pages, asynchronously renders the content of the section named .
member.param: Indicates the section must be registered (using @section) in the page.
member.returns: A that on completion returns an empty .
member.remarks: The method writes to the and the value returned is a token value that allows the Write (produced due to @RenderSection(..)) to succeed. However the value does not represent the rendered content.
member.exception: if is true and the section was not registered using the @section in the Razor page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.IgnoreSection(System.String)
member.summary: In layout pages, ignores rendering the content of the section named .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.FlushAsync
member.summary: Invokes on and on the response stream, writing out any buffered content to the .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous flush operation and on completion returns an empty .
member.remarks: The value returned is a token value that allows FlushAsync to work directly in an HTML section. However the value does not represent the rendered content. This method also writes out headers, so any modifications to headers must be done before is called. For example, call to send antiforgery cookie token and X-Frame-Options header to client before this method flushes headers out.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorPage.SetAntiforgeryCookieAndHeader
member.summary: Sets antiforgery cookie and X-Frame-Options header on the response.
member.remarks: Call this method to send antiforgery cookie token and X-Frame-Options header to client before flushes the headers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngine.GetNormalizedRouteValue(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ActionContext,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the case-normalized route value for the specified route .
member.returns: The value corresponding to the key.
member.remarks: The casing of a route value in is determined by the client. This making constructing paths for view locations in a case sensitive file system unreliable. Using the to get route values produces consistently cased results.

member.summary: Gets the sequence of instances used by to locate Razor files.
member.remarks: At startup, this is initialized to include an instance of that is rooted at the application root.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngineOptions.ViewLocationFormats
member.summary: Gets the locations where will search for views.

remarks.para: The locations of the views returned from controllers that do not belong to an area. Locations are format strings (see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx) which may contain the following format items:

The values for these locations are case-sensitive on case-sensitive file systems. For example, the view for the Test action of HomeController should be located at /Views/Home/Test.cshtml. Locations such as /views/home/test.cshtml would not be discovered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngineOptions.AreaViewLocationFormats
member.summary: Gets the locations where will search for views within an area.

remarks.para: The locations of the views returned from controllers that belong to an area. Locations are format strings (see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx) which may contain the following format items:

The values for these locations are case-sensitive on case-sensitive file systems. For example, the view for the Test action of HomeController under Admin area should be located at /Areas/Admin/Views/Home/Test.cshtml. Locations such as /areas/admin/views/home/test.cshtml would not be discovered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RazorViewEngineOptions.AdditionalCompilationReferences
